articles.author: Tim Reid, Gram Slattery, Helen Coster
articles.description: A grateful Donald Trump was in Milwaukee on Monday to make final preparations for the Republican presidential nomination later this week after narrowly escaping an assassination attempt that he said presented an opportunity to bring the country together.
articles.title: After attempt on his life, Trump sees moment for unity

articles.author: Aaron Josefczyk, Jasper Ward, Kanishka Singh
articles.description:
The FBI identified 20-year-old Thomas Matthew Crooks of Bethel Park, Pennsylvania as the suspect in Saturday's attempted assassination of former U.S. President Donald Trump at a campaign rally.
The suspect was shot and killed by the Secret Service seconds after he allegedly fired shots toward a stage where Trump and was speaking in Butler, Pennsylvania.
The FBI said it was working to determine a m
articles.title: Here's what we know about Thomas Matthew Crooks, the suspected Trump rally shooter

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel struck the southern and central Gaza Strip on Monday to put more pressure on Hamas, following a weekend strike targeting the militant group's leadership which killed scores of Palestinians camped in a designated "safe zone".
articles.title: Israel launches new Gaza strikes after weekend attack kills scores in safe zone

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Seeing the military patrol handing out call-up papers on the outskirts of Kyiv, one man slipped into a nearby store. Another refused to even stop for the officers. Others, however, quietly obliged.
articles.title: Ukraine's mobilisation campaign picks up despite faltering enthusiasm

articles.author: Tom Wilson
articles.description: A major Cambodian payments firm received crypto worth over $150,000 from a digital wallet used by North Korean hacking outfit Lazarus, blockchain data shows, a glimpse of how the criminal collective has laundered funds in Southeast Asia.
articles.title: Exclusive: North Korean hackers sent stolen crypto to wallet used by Asian payment firm

articles.author: Charlotte Greenfield, Gibran Peshimam
articles.description: Pakistan is planning to ban former Prime Minister Imran Khan's political party and move the country's top court to press treason charges against him, the information minister said on Monday.
articles.title: Pakistan to ban Imran Khan's party, file treason case against ex-PM

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Voters in Rwanda headed to the polls on Monday to elect their next president, with 66-year-old incumbent Paul Kagame who has ruled the central African country for nearly a quarter of a century expected to cruise to victory.
articles.title: Rwandans vote in election expected to extend Kagame's long rule

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Monday he aimed to have all the elements of a peace plan ready in November so that Kyiv could convene a second, follow-up international summit on his vision for peace.
articles.title: Zelenskiy aims to be ready for second peace summit in November

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Veteran communist politician K.P. Sharma Oli was sworn in as Nepal's prime minister on Monday, the fifth in five years, hoping to ensure political stability in the impoverished Himalayan nation that badly needs to woo investors and create jobs.
articles.title: Oli returns as Nepal's fifth PM in five years, promising political stability

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's left-wing parties still plan to form a joint government after they emerged as the strongest bloc in parliament in a snap election, but any pact is unlikely to come this week, the head of the Socialist Party (PS) said on Monday.
articles.title: France's left-wing parties struggle to unite, Socialists' leader says
